qas.question: In England and which other country is there a curricula that revolves around nutritional education?
What is the official name of the curricula that promotes nutritional education in schools?

answers.text: Personal and Social Education and Food Technology curricula

qas.question: Aside from dieting and general nutritional information, what else does the curricula in England and Wales aim to teach students?

answers.text: how to read nutrition labels on packaging

qas.question: In which type of school are kids required to take a number of health related courses?

context: Nutrition is taught in schools in many countries. In England and <a0_0>Wales<a0_0/>, the <a1_0>Personal and Social Education and Food Technology curricula<a1_0/> include nutrition, stressing the importance of a balanced diet and teaching <a3_0>how to read nutrition labels on packaging<a3_0/>. In many schools, a Nutrition class will fall within the <a2_0>Family and Consumer Science<a2_0/> or Health departments. In some <a4_0>American<a4_0/> schools, students are required to take a certain number of FCS or Health related classes. Nutrition is offered at many schools, and, if it is not a class of its own, nutrition is included in other FCS or Health classes such as: Life Skills, Independent Living, Single Survival, Freshmen Connection, Health etc. In many Nutrition classes, students learn about the food groups, the food pyramid, Daily Recommended Allowances, calories, vitamins, minerals, malnutrition, physical activity, healthful food choices, portion sizes, and how to live a healthy life.
